commit_message:
Fix execution report printing

* Shortened a task error string because sometimes it breaks the layout
* Handled a case when a task/action is in error state but doesn't
  have a state info

Change-Id: I2903806200c8430b497ceb01568f7aa2c55c4e3e

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-02-26 06:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-03-01 06:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If this is only needed in neutron-tempest-plugin, do we really want to define it within devstack? Why not define it in the repo that needs it directly? Or do you expect jobs from other repos to use the same nodeset definition?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-03-01 07:56:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> If this is only needed in neutron-tempest-plugin, do we really want
 > to define it within devstack? Why not define it in the repo that
 > needs it directly? Or do you expect jobs from other repos to use
 > the same nodeset definition?

I can define it in neutron repo, that's not a problem. I just tried to do it in similar way how it was done for xenial nodes (ubuntu-xenial-3-node) which are currently defined in openstack-infra / openstack-zuul-jobs instead of neutron repo. I choose Devstack because "openstack-two-node-bionic" is defined here too.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-03-04 10:49:10.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Ok, as frickler suggested, I moved it to neutron repo. It's added in patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633979/ as only this one job is using it"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-03-07 10:23:22.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

Yesterday I found that exactly same nodeset is used also in tobiko project: https://github.com/openstack/tobiko/blob/master/zuul.d/nodes.yaml so maybe we can add it here, together with other bionic node sets and reuse in neutron and tobiko?'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-03-07 10:37:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-05 22:26:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong default JsonDataReader() argument

It expect to use new JsonDataReader() instance as default argument
in function call, but it will be only created once when the function
is defined, and the same object is used in each successive call. It
does not work as expected. So Use default argument None to signal that
Reader was provided.

Change-Id: I8b659132e4699c2f9a1b8109869c3a6c1b3ca096
'}, {'created': '2019-03-06 03:55:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong default JsonDataReader() argument

It expect to use new JsonDataReader() instance as default argument
in function call, but it will be only created once when the function
is defined, and the same object is used in each successive call. It
does not work as expected. So Use default argument None to signal that
Reader was provided.

Change-Id: I8b659132e4699c2f9a1b8109869c3a6c1b3ca096
'}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong default JsonDataReader() argument

It expect to use new JsonDataReader() instance as default argument
in function call, but it will be only created once when the function
is defined, and the same object is used in each successive call. It
does not work as expected. So Use default argument None to signal that
Reader was provided.

Change-Id: I8b659132e4699c2f9a1b8109869c3a6c1b3ca096

commit_message:
[trivial] removing pagination in Get Introspection Data api-ref

Removing the mention of pagination in the API reference of Get
Introspection Data as it's not supported.
Follow-up of https://review.openstack.org/640288

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/640910/

Change-Id: I61e1689fdb8c74d4c898e10911781e9a2f7a82e9

to set this flag to true:

https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/b62baf7c16d4609ea92e2ffc974e2f3a0b1cec80/tempest/config.py#L896

And make it depend on this nova change using:

This is an already completed blueprint. You need something that just mentions adding the support for the rbd volume type in the libvirt driver for feature parity and target it to stein.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-12-06 21:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Implement support for extending attached volumes using the libvirt
network volume driver.

libvirt for network volumes. All other volume types currently
implementing the extend_volume call have a block device on the
hypervisor which needs to be updated and can be polled for it's new
size. For network volumes no such block device exists.

Alternatively this could be implemented without a new parameter by
calling into Ceph using os_brick to get the new size of the volume.

This also extends the logic to get the device_path for extending volumes
in the libvirt driver. This is necessary as network volumes don't have
the device path in the connection_info. The device_path is retrieved by
matching the connection_info serial (= volume UUID) against all guest

commit_message:
Extend volume for libvirt network volumes (RBD)

Implement support for extending RBD attached volumes using the libvirt
network volume driver.

This adds a new parameter "requested_size" to the extend_volume method.
This is necessary because the new volume size can not be detected by
libvirt for network volumes. All other volume types currently
implementing the extend_volume call have a block device on the
hypervisor which needs to be updated and can be polled for it's new
size. For network volumes no such block device exists.

Alternatively this could be implemented without a new parameter by
calling into Ceph using os_brick to get the new size of the volume.
This would make the LibvirtNetVolumeDriver Ceph specific.

This also extends the logic to get the device_path for extending volumes
in the libvirt driver. This is necessary as network volumes don't have
the device path in the connection_info. The device_path is retrieved by
matching the connection_info serial (= volume UUID) against all guest
disks.

Co-Authored-By: Jose Castro Leon <jose.castro.leon@cern.ch>

Blueprint: extend-in-use-rbd-volumes

Change-Id: I5698e451861828a8b1240d046d1610d8d37ca5a2

subject: Provide Windows compatibility
messages:
[{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-01-31 14:57:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-01-31 15:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-02-08 06:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

All aspects are covered in the specs, thank you lpetrut'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-02-14 11:27:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-02-14 23:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is a nicely written spec.  Since it's late in the cycle, I'd suggest that we release windows support as EXPERIMENTAL in Stein.  I'm a little worried about our tasks test coverage (though if Cinder has been ported to windows, Cinder uses taskflow, so maybe it's not an issue).  I took a quick look at the code patches, and they look good at first glance (ha!), so this isn't a crack about code quality, I'm just worried that there may be some issues that won't be caught by our current tests.

My primary concern about this spec, however, is committing the Glance project team to windows support when the CI that we need to guarantee this is 3rd party.  If the CI disappears, we will be in a bad place, and I'm not sure we can yank windows support without some deprecation period (during which time, we will be in a bad place).  Maybe we should simply claim that this is an effort to make Glance "windows compatible" but that the Glance project team cannot guarantee the level of support that we have for the platforms that are tested in the OpenStack CI.  (If we go the "compatibility" route, then my previous comment about releasing this as EXPERIMENTAL in Stein becomes irrelevant.)

I need someone to explain to me why the above aren't a concern before I'll be +2 on this.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-02-15 08:24:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> This is a nicely written spec.  Since it's late in the cycle, I'd
 > suggest that we release windows support as EXPERIMENTAL in Stein. 
 > I'm a little worried about our tasks test coverage (though if
 > Cinder has been ported to windows, Cinder uses taskflow, so maybe
 > it's not an issue).  I took a quick look at the code patches, and
 > they look good at first glance (ha!), so this isn't a crack about
 > code quality, I'm just worried that there may be some issues that
 > won't be caught by our current tests.
 > 
 > My primary concern about this spec, however, is committing the
 > Glance project team to windows support when the CI that we need to
 > guarantee this is 3rd party.  If the CI disappears, we will be in a
 > bad place, and I'm not sure we can yank windows support without
 > some deprecation period (during which time, we will be in a bad
 > place).  Maybe we should simply claim that this is an effort to
 > make Glance "windows compatible" but that the Glance project team
 > cannot guarantee the level of support that we have for the
 > platforms that are tested in the OpenStack CI.  (If we go the
 > "compatibility" route, then my previous comment about releasing
 > this as EXPERIMENTAL in Stein becomes irrelevant.)
 > 
 > I need someone to explain to me why the above aren't a concern
 > before I'll be +2 on this.

Thanks for reviewing this spec. I think it makes sense to mark Window support as experimental, at least for now. About test coverage: I'd say it's enough to cover most cases. If something is not covered by the tests, chances are that it won't work properly on Linux either. This is something that we can improve over time as new features mature.

About 3rd party CIs: I understand your concern. It's the same with other projects. Let's take Cinder for example: if one of the CIs stops working, they first mark the driver as unsupported and then remove it. No one can guarantee that the driver still works at that point. In my opinion it's a risk worth taking, especially since there are just a few changes required. If it puts Glance in a safer position, I think it's ok to use the "compatible" term rather than "supported", although this may create some confusion.

For what is worth, our CI Ansible playbooks are public [1]. If we ever become incapable of maintaining the CI, anyone interested in having Windows support in Glance (as well as other projects) may pick it up. There are no licensing costs as there are free Hyper-V versions and it can also run on top of recent QEMU releases. Still, I think that's highly unlikely as we've been contributing to OpenStack and maintaining our CIs for more than 5 years.

It's worth mentioning that we did deprecate the Linux SMB Cinder driver at some point, mostly because it was unused and it was not worth putting so much effort in maintaining it. Still, we kept testing it until it was completely removed. I think it's really unlikely that this will happen to the Glance Windows support because of two main reasons: we have demand for it and maintaing it doesn't require too much effort. Some platform specific features (e.g. xattr) are already nicely wrapped and the code doesn't make the assumption that those are present.

[1] https://github.com/cloudbase/openstack-cis/'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-02-19 16:14:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Lucian: thanks for your reply.  Let's see if Abhishek, Sean, or Erno have an opinion on the "compatible" vs. "supported" idea.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-02-22 17:37:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Hmm-m I guess compatibility is more suitable term indeed. Didn't really think of the oblications coming with claiming it actually supported.

I think there is no reason to flag it experimental either if we call it compatibility, as soon as we have the CI running we know it mostly works and any corner cases landing on us can be worked through normal bug reporting-fixing cycle."}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-02-25 12:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2019-02-25 12:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Makes sense. Well, I've updated the spec and commit message to use the "Windows compatible" term. The blueprint name is "windows-support", I'd probably have to propose a new one and update all the related patches just to change one word. I really hope that won't be necessary. I think that the spec along with this discussion should be enough for posterity.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-02-25 18:28:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Thanks for making the change to the text.  No need to worry about the blueprint name or URL.  I agree with Erno that since we're only claiming 'compatibility', we don't need to go the EXPERIMENTAL route."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-02-27 13:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-01 14:42:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I think this would be good to get in.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-03-06 05:13:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-03-07 11:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Provide Windows compatibility

The goal is to allow Glance services to run on Windows, which
enables Hyper-V OpenStack deployments to take full advantage of
Microsoft storage solutions.

blueprint windows-support

Change-Id: I49c83a9c02c0d44edbbfc91caba9caf57706f669

commit_message:
Add API v2 jobs (scenario, tempest); buildimages fixes

Run also: the API v2 scenario and tempest tests on both the check
and the gate queue.

Remove the list of plugins from required-project, as it was added
to the definition of the job in sahara-tests.git.

Finally, make sure that the base buildimages job depend on the
sahara repository and that it uses the sahara source directory
as working directory.

Change-Id: I97a302e253516cdd827c522178fca5fb5590f00c

messages: [{'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-03-07 08:13:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-03-07 08:14:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nApproving to unblock the gate. Please don't forget to revert once we fix it."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-07 08:13:55.000000000', 'message': 'Temporary marking ironic-standalone non-voting

The ironic-standalone job is failing because the most recent IPA
image has only python3 and ansible uses python 2 as default
interpreter, resulting in a /usr/bin/python not found error.
Marking ironic-standalone non voting and removing it from the
gate until we can run ansible with python3 on remote machines.

Change-Id: Id03b02ea805809c35c4ef34bd1b255d7f6e6d4a7
'}]
commit_message:
Temporary marking ironic-standalone non-voting

The ironic-standalone job is failing because the most recent IPA
image has only python3 and ansible uses python 2 as default
interpreter, resulting in a /usr/bin/python not found error.
Marking ironic-standalone non voting and removing it from the
gate until we can run ansible with python3 on remote machines.

Change-Id: Id03b02ea805809c35c4ef34bd1b255d7f6e6d4a7

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Added ability to skip enabled backends pre-check

When using custom storage backends with cinder.conf overrides file,
precheck stage in kolla-ansible is fail. This commit adds option
'skip_cinder_backend_check' (default: False) to cinder role.

Change-Id: Ifee138ad8b281903ea2365441aada044c80c46f0

subject: NaNJSONEncoder should be used in api "cinder/tenantabsolutelimits"
messages: [{'account_id': 14892, 'date': '2019-03-06 15:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/pike.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-03-06 16:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-03-06 16:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2019-03-06 20:03:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2019-03-06 22:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-03-07 10:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-06 15:55:27.000000000', 'message': 'NaNJSONEncoder should be used in api "cinder/tenantabsolutelimits"

In api "cinder/tenantabsolutelimits", result maybe contains Infinity values,
but Infinity values are not supported by JSON standard, so NaNJSONEncoder is
needed here.

Change-Id: I750637e3214ad46a8b29e1ad565870cdcb827fe1
Closes-bug: #1714417
(cherry picked from commit de37fc1024a2e02cb9ec0f29a6dbd218474072df)
(cherry picked from commit 2cda101cf9cea1684fa6be2b1929ac758708d0cb)
'}]
commit_message:
NaNJSONEncoder should be used in api "cinder/tenantabsolutelimits"

In api "cinder/tenantabsolutelimits", result maybe contains Infinity values,
but Infinity values are not supported by JSON standard, so NaNJSONEncoder is
needed here.

Change-Id: I750637e3214ad46a8b29e1ad565870cdcb827fe1
Closes-bug: #1714417
(cherry picked from commit de37fc1024a2e02cb9ec0f29a6dbd218474072df)
(cherry picked from commit 2cda101cf9cea1684fa6be2b1929ac758708d0cb)

commit_message:
Add a Blazar Host resource

Add a OS::Blazar::Host resource plugin to support Blazar which is a
resource reservation services in OpenStack.

Co-author: Asmita Singh <Asmita.Singh@nttdata.com>

Change-Id: Ie5b9373681943222268eb9144740f5733ffef750
Task: 22881
Story: 2002085

commit_message:
osc-placement: release stein 1.5.0

This is the final release for Stein, which adds support for
microversion 1.18 of the placement API
('required' query parameter to the GET /resource_providers API).

Change-Id: I7fe629cde8d55e3d0677e89328f8e5a1c0825665

[{'created': '2019-03-05 16:18:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multiattach set to false after retype

The return value of get_by_name_or_id in the volume_types module
returns a dictionary.
During the function call to _is_multiattach, the getattr() returns
{}(default value) because a dictionary is passed instead of an object.
After importing the cinder.objects.volume_type module,
the current function call to get_by_name_or_id() returns an object
hence getattr() will return the appropriate extra_specs instead of
the default value({}).

Closes-Bug: 1790840
Change-Id: I869bc0c9b18887da1ea83f855d255557f0f3cba0
(cherry picked from commit 7f85be418669286392c833479dfdc7c2a33f86d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix multiattach set to false after retype

The return value of get_by_name_or_id in the volume_types module
returns a dictionary.
During the function call to _is_multiattach, the getattr() returns
{}(default value) because a dictionary is passed instead of an object.
After importing the cinder.objects.volume_type module,
the current function call to get_by_name_or_id() returns an object
hence getattr() will return the appropriate extra_specs instead of
the default value({}).

Closes-Bug: 1790840
Change-Id: I869bc0c9b18887da1ea83f855d255557f0f3cba0
(cherry picked from commit 7f85be418669286392c833479dfdc7c2a33f86d1)

commit_message:
Add JSON driver for access rules config

The access rules config driver will read a JSON file that represents
rules for accessing service APIs. This is to support application
credential access rules, which will be checked against the configured
rules upon creation. The name for this new API is borrowed from Istio's
near identical concept[1].

[1] https://istio.io/docs/reference/config/authorization/istio.rbac.v1alpha1/#AccessRule

bp whitelist-extension-for-app-creds

Change-Id: If8b9c1e9df55874052dfd9b99fbcea6e06c1ca35

subject: Revert "Revert "Add link to activity metrics to team pages""
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-02-13 16:41:44.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from code-change to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-02-13 17:37:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I haven't made up my mind here yet, but concerns raised in IRC include:

* officially promoting any "activity" metrics about our projects potentially sends the message that this is something our community values

* focus on contextless measures of "activity" can be competitive and divisive in nature

* stackalytics.com (at least for the moment) as an unpublished proprietary fork of the older public source code is essentially no longer open source, though its authors have made some assertion of their intent to correct this oversight

* when it was the OSF linking/providing this from their www.openstack.org site we at least had a way to say that was being provided at the request of foundation members not our technical contributors, but as an elected representative body adding this to our section of the governance.openstack.org site makes it much harder to claim

Discussion begins at http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/%23openstack-tc.2019-02-13.log.html#t2019-02-13T14:21:47 for those interested in referencing it directly.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-02-13 17:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

A bit more information... the general idea is to stop talking about teams in software pages (like https://www.openstack.org/software/releases/rocky/components/nova) to better focus on... software, but also leave space to acknowledge the work of other teams (like i18n or docs).

So I proposed to replace that "team information" by a link to the team pages on the governance website, avoiding duplication. That meant no more Stackalytics data, so I proposed re-adding a link to that to the governance team pages instead.

That said I understand that it could be construed as promoting Stackalytics, which  might be undesirable. On one hand it buries that information much further down, but on the other it taints the TC website a bit.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-02-13 19:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I842e186f113727badfecff78eb37f74c225c1a22 is related, and removes the other remaining use of Stackalytics in this repository.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-02-13 22:26:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd prefer the TC not confer any legitimacy on Stackalytics, for a variety of reasons. It seems that the folks who care about stats don't have any real trouble finding it anyway."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-02-14 08:24:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> * stackalytics.com (at least for the moment) as an unpublished
 > proprietary fork of the older public source code is essentially no
 > longer open source, (snipped)

That is a big deal for me.
We can't ensure this website will be published to our standards. It is not even maintained by us.
(In other words, giving legitimacy to something that is not respecting our open standards sounds a little weird to me).

If that changes, I could change my vote."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-02-14 11:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Note that it's likely that Mirantis will end up publishing the code for the current Stackalytics, but I'm not sure that should change our decision... the issue is more that a specific party controls the instance and can do whatever with it (as proven by the recent refresh)."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-19 01:22:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Note that it's likely that Mirantis will end up publishing the code
 > for the current Stackalytics, but I'm not sure that should change
 > our decision... the issue is more that a specific party controls
 > the instance and can do whatever with it (as proven by the recent
 > refresh).

I feel like we should wait until that code is published."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-02-19 01:25:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

> > * stackalytics.com (at least for the moment) as an unpublished
 > > proprietary fork of the older public source code is essentially
 > no
 > > longer open source, (snipped)
 > 
 > That is a big deal for me.
 > We can't ensure this website will be published to our standards. It
 > is not even maintained by us.
 > (In other words, giving legitimacy to something that is not
 > respecting our open standards sounds a little weird to me).
 > 
 > If that changes, I could change my vote.

I used it the day before it was updated, and the day after... and the data was dramatically different, so however it is calculating data internally is not understood by us, and I don't think can be relied up on until the code is accessible. As such, my vote is no at this time."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-19 12:07:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

Agree with others: Until the code is available, that's enough for a -1

But also, conferring some blessing on stackalytics, even if tangentially is not something I'm keen on."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-02-19 23:42:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-03-07 09:40:46.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

OK let's abandon this -- at least for now."}]

commit_message:
Support passing a dictionary for configdrive

API version 1.56 introduces support for building configdrive on the
server side. In this case configdrive is a dictionary, this changes
adds support for it.

Change-Id: I2b870fc89aa31c13b33f76b14acd6ee959800554
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/639050
Story: #2005083
Task: #29841

commit_message:
Use unique and predictable temp folder for reproducer

Replace the previous used of random temp folder on reproducer which
did create a new temp directory on each execution of the same script.

Now the temporary folder will not be random and will be based on the
hash of the reproducer script. This means that running the same
script twice should reuse the folder, also it means that two people
running the same reproducer script on two machines are likely to
use the same temp directory.

Change-Id: Ia088c3353268580dad9925ab6fe354bf5f0c9408

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-06 10:05:29.000000000', 'message': 'Warn if group_policy is missing from flavor

If there are more than one numbered request group in an allocation
candidate query then the group_policy paramtere is mandatory. Numbered
request groups can come from the flavor extra_spec as well as from
neutron port having resource request. This patch adds a warning if the
group_policy is missing to help the troubleshooting. Nova cannot default
the policy in this case as both isolat and None could be a valid policy
for SRIOV ports. Isolate would mean PF anti affinity for SRIOV ports
while None would allow colocation of the VFs.

blueprint bandwidth-resource-provider

Change-Id: I32d9704fe19bc85e06a613b6dffb99f00003315e

blueprint bandwidth-resource-provider

Change-Id: I32d9704fe19bc85e06a613b6dffb99f00003315e

commit_message:
Warn if group_policy is missing from flavor

If there are more than one numbered request group in an allocation
candidate query then the group_policy paramtere is mandatory. Numbered
request groups can come from the flavor extra_spec as well as from
neutron port having resource request. This patch adds a warning if the
group_policy is missing to help the troubleshooting. Nova cannot default
the policy in this case as both isolat and None could be a valid policy
for SRIOV ports. Isolate would mean PF anti affinity for SRIOV ports
while None would allow colocation of the VFs.

blueprint bandwidth-resource-provider

Change-Id: I32d9704fe19bc85e06a613b6dffb99f00003315e

commit_message:
WIP Deploy Sahara with unversioned endpoints

Sahara supports unversioned endpoint also for the stable API v1.1,
and this is a requirement in order to use the experimental API v2.
See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582285/ for more details.

Closes-Bug: #1782147
Change-Id: I848b6846e0096decc13f9512026e8b8ce93d1373

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-12 11:40:46.000000000', 'message': '[stable/queens] Add a check for kernels args update to avoid unnecessary reboot

In OSP10 NFV deployments, the kernel args are applied using the
userdata scripts (first-boot). In OSP13 NFV deployments, the userdata
scripts are rebooted, instead PreNetworkConfig resource is added
to allow kernel args configuration and reboot. During FFU, instead
of using the first-boot, migrating to PreNetworkConfig resource,
requires a check to ensure that a additional reboot is not applied.

After OSP13 fresh deployment and subsequent updates, the reboot is
avoided by removing UPDATE in the deployment_actions of PreNetworkConfig.
During FFU, addition of PreNetworkConfig will result in the CREATE
action, as it is created first time (not available in OSP10), this
additional check is required to avoid reboot.
Closes-Bug: #1813610

Change-Id: I89c7a686c301861defe23963f6aa8c36c43c4bb5

userdata scripts (first-boot). In queens NFV deployments, the userdata
scripts are rebooted, instead PreNetworkConfig resource is added
to allow kernel args configuration and reboot. During FFU, instead
of using the first-boot, migrating to PreNetworkConfig resource,
requires a check to ensure that a additional reboot is not applied.

After queens fresh deployment and subsequent updates, the reboot is

commit_message:
[stable/queens] Add a check for kernels args update to avoid unnecessary reboot

In newton NFV deployments, the kernel args are applied using the
userdata scripts (first-boot). In queens NFV deployments, the userdata
scripts are rebooted, instead PreNetworkConfig resource is added
to allow kernel args configuration and reboot. During FFU, instead
of using the first-boot, migrating to PreNetworkConfig resource,
requires a check to ensure that a additional reboot is not applied.

After queens fresh deployment and subsequent updates, the reboot is
avoided by removing UPDATE in the deployment_actions of PreNetworkConfig.
During FFU, addition of PreNetworkConfig will result in the CREATE
action, as it is created first time (not available in newton), this
additional check is required to avoid reboot.
Closes-Bug: #1813610

Change-Id: I89c7a686c301861defe23963f6aa8c36c43c4bb5

commit_message:
[stable/queens] Disable default config-download method for PreNetworkConfig

While backporting config-download support for NFV from rocky, the
default option is to use config-download. But in queens the default
option is to use heat with an opt-in config-download support. Disable
config-download based resources and provide an option to enable via
environment file.
Related-Bug: #1813610

Change-Id: I9c0bf922555f9c3cd8c11e42e2ee525490754845

commit_message:
NFV: Support for config-download to deploy node with kernel args

For NFV deployments, specific kernel args should be applied and
the nodes should be restarted before running the NetworkDeployment.
It is supported in the heat deployment via PreNetworkConfig. In the
config-download mechanism, ansible steps need to be improved
to handle the reboot and wait for the node.
Related-Bug: #1813610

Change-Id: I43b383ad0e04b8be6c321f8c5b05e628b2520141
(cherry picked from commit a3e4a9063612a617105e318e422d90706e4ed43e)

commit_message:
Adding a udev rule to save sriov interface name before configuring switchdev

After moving mlnx interfaces to switchdev mode in sriov, it will
reset that interface and may change its name and also will need ifup
in order to get back the previous configuration.
So adding a udev rule and ifup command the save the interface name
and its configuration

Change-Id: Ib4f384da344344f9e2ec666b0d8dbae441f24568
Closes-Bug: 1816710

[{'created': '2019-01-28 19:03:19.000000000', 'message': 'Changing segmentation ID of existing network should be allowed

In the context of a live datacenter, sometimes the network teams re-organize
their VLANs by changing VLAN IDs. This is pretty straightforward in the
context of network configuration and physical servers, but when using ML2
VLAN provider networks, those IDs cannot be updated. The only possible
solution here would be to delete those networks and recreate them with a
different segmentation ID which might be a problem when you have 1000 VMs
and 2000 ports.

For this reason it would be good if we could change the segmentation ID of
an existing network.

Change-Id: I71b5b4ff2ba7ace3a8523de2ae6e4dc6a1c110c2
Related-Bug: #1806052

commit_message:
Changing segmentation ID of existing network should be allowed

In the context of a live datacenter, sometimes the network teams re-organize
their VLANs by changing VLAN IDs. This is pretty straightforward in the
context of network configuration and physical servers, but when using ML2
VLAN provider networks, those IDs cannot be updated. The only possible
solution here would be to delete those networks and recreate them with a
different segmentation ID which might be a problem when you have 1000 VMs
and 2000 ports.

For this reason it would be good if we could change the segmentation ID of
an existing network.

Change-Id: I71b5b4ff2ba7ace3a8523de2ae6e4dc6a1c110c2
Related-Bug: #1806052

resource reservation services in OpenStack.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-05 20:26:25.000000000', 'message': 'Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

The above change requires a sync from charm-helpers.

Additionally the transport_url directive has been moved to the
[DEFAULT] section.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop
deprecation warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

test_300_cinder_config is also removed in this change as amulet
tests no longer need to confirm config file settings.

Change-Id: Ia93be49430e8d95c38ed521d08bbb62f47e13e59
Closes-Bug: #1817672
'}]
commit_message:
Update rabbit driver config options

The stein version of python-oslo.messaging (9.0.0+) has removed
the following config options from the [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
section:

rabbit_host, rabbit_port, rabbit_hosts, rabbit_userid,
rabbit_password, rabbit_virtual_host rabbit_max_retries, and
rabbit_durable_queues.

The above change requires a sync from charm-helpers.

Additionally the transport_url directive has been moved to the
[DEFAULT] section.

These have been deprecated since Ocata, therefore this change
will be provided to pre-Stein templates in order to drop
deprecation warnings.

See release notes at:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/oslo.messaging/index.html

test_300_cinder_config is also removed in this change as amulet
tests no longer need to confirm config file settings.

Change-Id: Ia93be49430e8d95c38ed521d08bbb62f47e13e59
Closes-Bug: #1817672

[{'created': '2019-03-04 12:16:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix TypeError: __str__ returned non-string (type ImageRefValidationFailed)

This change contains two fixes for the same issue:
* Do not pass an instance of ImageRefValidationFailed as a message
  to an exception constructor.
* Make sure that IronicException.__str__ always returns an str,
  even when a non-string is passed as the first argument to __init__.

Change-Id: I96edb28955e64915e9d6a481634857fd27690555
Story: #2003682
Task: #26206
'}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError: __str__ returned non-string (type ImageRefValidationFailed)

This change contains two fixes for the same issue:
* Do not pass an instance of ImageRefValidationFailed as a message
  to an exception constructor.
* Make sure that IronicException.__str__ always returns an str,
  even when a non-string is passed as the first argument to __init__.

Change-Id: I96edb28955e64915e9d6a481634857fd27690555
Story: #2003682
Task: #26206

commit_message:
objects: Store InstancePCIRequest.numa_policy in DB

In change I9360fe29908, we added the 'numa_policy' field to the
'InstancePCIRequest' object. Unfortunately we did not update the
(de)serialization logic for the 'InstancePCIRequests' object, meaning
this field was never saved to the database. As a result, claiming will
always fail [1].

The resolution is simple - add the (de)serialization logic and tests to
prevent regression.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/18.0.0/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L214-L215

Change-Id: Id4d8ecb8fee46b21590ebcc62a2850030cef6508
Closes-Bug: #1805891

[{'created': '2019-03-04 07:38:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auth url for Barbican client

This patch fixes up the auth url if an invalid or no version prefix is
set in OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL. An invalid prefix could be /v2.0 endpoint
when running Keystone v3.

keystoneclient.auth.token_endpoint is deprecated as of the 2.1.0 release
in favor of keystoneauth1.token_endpoint.Token. Reason why it is being
used here is because keystoneauth1 is not in our requirements.txt
(although it is a dependency pulled by required libraries) making this
patch not backportable if we were to add it now. A follow up patch
should handle this deprecation.

Story: 2005101
Task: 29723

Change-Id: Ib09c954180d4b545d05344dc2c318a48c9b8d4e4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix auth url for Barbican client

This patch fixes up the auth url if an invalid or no version prefix is
set in OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL. An invalid prefix could be /v2.0 endpoint
when running Keystone v3.

keystoneclient.auth.token_endpoint is deprecated as of the 2.1.0 release
in favor of keystoneauth1.token_endpoint.Token. Reason why it is being
used here is because keystoneauth1 is not in our requirements.txt
(although it is a dependency pulled by required libraries) making this
patch not backportable if we were to add it now. A follow up patch
should handle this deprecation.

Story: 2005101
Task: 29723

Change-Id: Ib09c954180d4b545d05344dc2c318a48c9b8d4e4

commit_message:
doc: cleanup pci.alias references

The admin and user flavor docs on pci.alias were not super
helpful by just throwing the user to the config docs or
flavor docs and letting them figure it out. This change
helps the reader by linking directly to the things being
referenced.

Also cleans up a pci.passthrough config option reference
while in here.

Change-Id: Ie2e28a14ff4655e38a5db3925adcd605ac773843

[{'created': '2019-03-06 08:19:45.000000000', 'message': 'Always run chmod privileged in remotefs drivers

Due to the switch to privsep new files are always created
with owner root in the remotefs drivers.
In order to be able to chmod these files
the drivers have to run the follow up operations from
a privileged context.
This adds a chmod method to the path privsep class and
moves chmod ops in remotefs and related classes to this
new privsep op.
Also updates a comment on these ops being run for
filesystems, not only for NFS.

Closes-Bug: #1818504
Change-Id: I70e55cf43d2d71f533325b745070746ddfae547b
'}]
commit_message:
Always run chmod privileged in remotefs drivers

Due to the switch to privsep new files are always created
with owner root in the remotefs drivers.
In order to be able to chmod these files
the drivers have to run the follow up operations from
a privileged context.
This adds a chmod method to the path privsep class and
moves chmod ops in remotefs and related classes to this
new privsep op.
Also updates a comment on these ops being run for
filesystems, not only for NFS.

Closes-Bug: #1818504
Change-Id: I70e55cf43d2d71f533325b745070746ddfae547b

commit_message:
Add actions

``demote`` is used to demote all images in all pools, used for
operator controlled fail over/fall back.

``promote`` is used to promote all images in all pools, used for
operator controlled or disaster recovery fail over/fall back.

``refresh-pools`` is used to refresh list of eligible pools from
local Ceph cluster.  Side effect is to enable mirroring of pools
created manually without the use of the charm ceph broker protocol.

Change-Id: I9af983b37045f83a0a9703e2212b371b97dc3121
Depends-On: I97bfb9a2c0e30998566aee56d4630af6baa36d45

commit_message:
fakelibvirt: Add ability to generate fake PCI devices

We already support generating fake PFs and VFs. Now add the ability to
generate fake non-SR-IOV devices. This is mostly an exercise in
refactoring, as we remove a lot of unused configurability and generally
clean things up as we go.

This isn't used yet. We do that in a later patch.

Change-Id: I22e3166ef3b706add88c6b909af024022f2243a8

commit_message:
Store journal log in functional tests results

It may helpdebug some issues related to keepalived and/or
dnsmasq which are logging to journal only.

Change-Id: I42c311f9111e0a0d1a6ea3a7aeab0fef8d77c549

commit_message:
pacemaker: force the use of docker for ContainerCli

Until we get CentOS8 to test Pacemaker with Podman, we need to keep
using Docker for ContainerCli now.

Later, when CentOS8 is out, we'll have a conditional we only set this
variable to 'docker' on CentOS7.

Change-Id: I7fc9a880f15463fd7d95be5ae46c1c1d2f339448

commit_message:
Script to identify tests passing on FS021 but still on skip list

This script checks a console log from a tempest run against a skip
list file in order to identify which tests are still in the skip list,
but it's already passing on featureset 021 (which run's full tempest
without skiping tests)

Usage:
check_skip.py --log-url http://log.o.o/tempest.log --skip-file
path/to/skip/list

Taiga task: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/718?kanban-status=1447276
Change-Id: Ibd03cb2f7e4d2ca6301cad04e100be05fe7bfffb

[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:23:11.000000000', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I2a34080d1c4dac57e5739e56b508f47f924f662f
Story: #2004073
Task: #27440
"}, {'created': '2019-02-15 21:06:43.000000000', 'message': 'add python 3.7 unit test job

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I2a34080d1c4dac57e5739e56b508f47f924f662f

Task: #27440

commit_message:
add python 3.7 unit test job

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I2a34080d1c4dac57e5739e56b508f47f924f662f
Story: #2004073
Task: #27440

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-03-04 16:47:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-03-05 11:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2019-03-05 20:13:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for fixing this.

I think there are two issues:
1. 'interface' argument is broken; we aren't taking that into consideration. Broken since Pike.
2. new 'valid_interfaces' argument that we don't support, but which (I think) nova started to use in Queens, with ironicclient.

If that is true, then this is a feature and a bug? Or do we consider both to be bugs?"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-03-05 23:59:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Thanks for fixing this.
 > 
 > I think there are two issues:
 > 1. 'interface' argument is broken; we aren't taking that into
 > consideration. Broken since Pike.
 > 2. new 'valid_interfaces' argument that we don't support, but which
 > (I think) nova started to use in Queens, with ironicclient.
 > 
 > If that is true, then this is a feature and a bug? Or do we
 > consider both to be bugs?

This is very much a bug, and we should backport the fix because:

 1. ironicclient broke backward compatibility in queens by not allowing any endpoint other than public endpoint, which bakes the second argument.
 2. this represents a security risk because this limitation force operators to open up public network access for the controllers. The controller network in production is segmented off, which does not have routes to public networks.

Right now, as I mentioned in the comments, KSA only cares about the 'interface' argument as far as get_endpoint() is concerned. 'valid_interfaces' is done via loading. The problem with ironicclient right now is that it is using using the legacy interfaces. We really need to modernize the code. We don't need to SessionClient wrapping anymore I think. But that should be done in a separate story though."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-03-06 00:43:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2019-03-06 15:13:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

Thanks, I'm good with this. Would like some clarification first. At this point, you know more about the code than I do :) I find the unit tests to be odd; I'm not totally sure what-all is being tested and left a question there for you.

If 'valid_interfaces' isn't used by Session etc, why is it being passed in as an argument. Is it because there is some other way to authenticate, that the client doesn't support yet?"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2019-03-06 15:15:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-06 16:28:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> If 'valid_interfaces' isn't used by Session etc, why is it being passed in as an argument. Is it because there is some other way to authenticate, that the client doesn't support yet?

Hi Ruby. It's a ksa thing, which means it's part of the config inherited from ksa, which means operators will be encouraged to start using 'valid_interfaces' instead of 'interface' in their configs. I can't speak to other consumers of this client (are there any?) but from the nova side, since we still have this hacked-up translation layer from the conf to ksa adapter to ironicclient kwargs back to ksa adapter, we could definitely get away with not including the 'valid_interfaces' support in the *backportable* version of this patch. In fact, that's probably the right thing to do: just support 'interfaces' here for backporting purposes, and then do a master-only change to add support for 'valid_interfaces'.

See discussion on the nova side of this [1] - whose split-out changes would actually then map 1:1 with the above proposed split-out of this change.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/640879/"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-06 16:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2019-03-06 17:11:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 19:13:37.000000000', 'message': 'convey endpoint interface to http client

Currennt, HTTP client does endpoint lookup from the service catalog using
endpoint filter. The filter is constructed from the interface attribute, which
is set to public interface by default. Unfortunately, we never convey
the interface when constructing the HTTP client. And consequently, we
are unable to use any other interfaces other than just public. This is
a severe limitation and also incompatible with Pike configuration.
This patch re-enables the endpoint filtering functionality by setting
the interface argument when constructing the HTTP client.

Change-Id: I610836e5038774621690aca88b2aee25670f0262
story: 2005118

commit_message:
pass endpoint interface to http client

The 'interface' argument was being ignored so that the HTTP client was
always using the public endpoint for Ironic. This fixes it so that the
'interface' argument is taken into consideration.

There's also no need to explicitly set the interface to 'publicURL'
because that's already the default in keystoneauth.

Change-Id: I610836e5038774621690aca88b2aee25670f0262
story: 2005118
task: 29802

commit_message:

to a Barbican targeted Octavia integration scenario test job.

and Octavia touch points.

commit_message:
Enable AppRole authentication support for Vault

Expose Castellan's AppRole configuration options in the vault_plugin
section to allow access to Vault to be managed using AppRoles which
is better aligned to providing long term application access to Vault
with policy based ACL's.

Change-Id: I2bafd06e2e2b1bfefe2b4c4bcbecf80d924db205
Related-Bug: 1796851
Story: 2004017
Task: 27003
Depends-On: I59dfe31adb72712c53d49f66d9ac894e43e8bbad

commit_message:
Remove environments/baremetal-services.yaml

Deploying services on baremetal isn't supported nor tested anymore, we
shouldn't provide an environment that would confuse our users.

This patch removes the environment file so it doesn't confuse users, and
also so we don't have to maintain it anymore.

Change-Id: Ic36e4459346daafd288f0767186e4df17f01a0b5

commit_message:
CI: force ContainerCli to Docker when needed

For the CI scenarios which still run Pacemaker, let's force ContainerCli
until we get them working with Podman.

Change-Id: I8405a00c7e4686b1569f6e68e3c1507f1e11b3a3

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-06 23:29:22.000000000', 'message': 'Remove outdated/incorrect certificate advice

This was from when we thought Anchor was the future of our internal cert
authority configuration. Self-signed certs are perfectly acceptable for
production deployments.

Change-Id: I5351a3bc4f1d80846ecbc7e1a77a47d9b91d7de7
'}]
commit_message:
Remove outdated/incorrect certificate advice

This was from when we thought Anchor was the future of our internal cert
authority configuration. Self-signed certs are perfectly acceptable for
production deployments.

Change-Id: I5351a3bc4f1d80846ecbc7e1a77a47d9b91d7de7

commit_message:
Update required version of taskflow

2.16.0 is from a Queens release -- push things
forward a bit to reduce the odds that we'll
end up with issues related to dependency updates
(such as networkx 2.0) or Python 3.

Change-Id: I2b96530b32d7a32acb653d2b432e1421c12554bf

[{'created': '2019-03-06 17:14:56.000000000', 'message': "Accept 'valid_interfaces' in client setup

The consumer of ironicclient may be deriving their get_client kwargs
from config inherited from ksa, where the 'interface' option has been
deprecated in favor of 'valid_interfaces'. To accomodate this, we accept
'valid_interfaces' as a kwarg, giving it precedence over 'interface'.
However, we still accept 'interface', as the consumer may be deriving
kwargs from a non-conf source (such as an already-created ksa Adapter
where 'valid_interfaces' has already been translated to 'interfaces'.

Co-Authored-By: guang-yee <guang.yee@suse.com>

Change-Id: I3b6fa53005f143d34f03bb1ed71c0aa04b7fce7b
"}, {'created': '2019-03-07 02:39:44.000000000', 'message': "Accept 'valid_interfaces' in client setup

'valid_interfaces' as a kwarg, giving it precedence over 'interface'.
However, we still accept 'interface', as the consumer may be deriving
kwargs from a non-conf source (such as an already-created ksa Adapter
where 'valid_interfaces' has already been translated to 'interfaces'.

Change-Id: I3b6fa53005f143d34f03bb1ed71c0aa04b7fce7b
"}]
commit_message:
Accept 'valid_interfaces' in client setup

The consumer of ironicclient may be deriving their get_client kwargs
from config inherited from ksa, where the 'interface' option has been
deprecated in favor of 'valid_interfaces'. To accomodate this, we accept
'valid_interfaces' as a kwarg, giving it precedence over 'interface'.
However, we still accept 'interface', as the consumer may be deriving
kwargs from a non-conf source (such as an already-created ksa Adapter
where 'valid_interfaces' has already been translated to 'interfaces'.

Co-Authored-By: guang-yee <guang.yee@suse.com>

Change-Id: I3b6fa53005f143d34f03bb1ed71c0aa04b7fce7b

commit_message:
Add resource_filters.json to Cinder's configmap

During the Stein development cycle, Cinder removed the deprecated
query_volume_filters configuration option with
Icd311db7f88c3c274d9a362eb96519e46c7e4d17.

This chart update will add resource_filters.json to the configmap and
provides the default values for the filter keys to enable filtering in
the list APIs.

Change-Id: I31263e9ce06d31773e961ae5d1252e062a38a4e5
Signed-off-by: Robert Church <robert.church@windriver.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-05 22:18:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix WeighedHost logging regression

Change I8666e0af3f057314f6b06939a108411b8a88d64b in Pike
refactored some code in the FilterScheduler which accidentally
changed how the list of weighed hosts are logged, which caused
the wrapped HostState objects to be logged rather than the
WeighedHost objects, which contain the actual "weight" attribute
which is useful for debugging weigher configuration and
scheduling decisions.

This fixes the regression by logging the weighed hosts before
stripping off the WeighedHost wrapper and adds a simple wrinkle
to an existing test to assert we are logging the correct object.

Change-Id: I528794b4b6f0007efc1238ad28dc402456664f86
Closes-Bug: #1816360
'}]
commit_message:
Fix WeighedHost logging regression

Change I8666e0af3f057314f6b06939a108411b8a88d64b in Pike
refactored some code in the FilterScheduler which accidentally
changed how the list of weighed hosts are logged, which caused
the wrapped HostState objects to be logged rather than the
WeighedHost objects, which contain the actual "weight" attribute
which is useful for debugging weigher configuration and
scheduling decisions.

This fixes the regression by logging the weighed hosts before
stripping off the WeighedHost wrapper and adds a simple wrinkle
to an existing test to assert we are logging the correct object.

Change-Id: I528794b4b6f0007efc1238ad28dc402456664f86
Closes-Bug: #1816360

It'd pass testing (same as what we have, for now), but then it'd lock all of openstack to that version for UC.txt."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-02-27 19:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-02-27 19:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[Q] Is the library actively maintained?
[A] They had 4 releases in the last 6 months.

[Q] Is the library good code?
[A] They have code coverage > 90% with around 600 unit tests;
[A] They use Travis as CI;
[A] They have over 500 commits, 30 releases and 60 contributors.

[Q] Is the library python 3 compatible?
[A] Yes, their travis runs against python 3.6

[Q] Is the library license compatible?

    does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
[A] N/A

Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add Hashicorp Vault Python Client (hvac)

This library will be used in Castellan to enhance the Hashicorp
Vault backend.

[Q] Is the library actively maintained?
[A] They had 4 releases in the last 6 months.

[Q] Is the library good code?
[A] They have code coverage > 90% with around 600 unit tests;
[A] They use Travis as CI;
[A] They have over 500 commits, 30 releases and 60 contributors.

[Q] Is the library python 3 compatible?
[A] Yes, their travis runs against python 3.6

[Q] Is the library license compatible?
[A] hvac   # Apache-2.0
[A] pyhcl  # Mozilla-2.0
[A] ply    # BSD

[Q] Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
    latest / Fedora latest)?
[A] The library distributed through PyPI.

[Q] Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
    in global-requirements.txt?
[A] No, this functionality is only provided by hvac or async-hvac.

[Q] Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
    infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?
[A] OpenStack project: Olso/Castellan.

[Q] If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
    does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
[A] N/A

Change-Id: Ib52b7b35aa64717de3489d4597bed1b2936429e1
Signed-off-by: Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate masakari CLI

All Masakari supported APIs are now available in OSC so it's time to
deprecate python-masakariclient.

This point was discussed during Stein PTG [1] and
masakari weekly IRC meeting.

[1]: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/masakari-ptg-stein

commit_message:
Fix:add python-glanceclient to cyborg requirements

Because in cyborg/image/glance.py line 33 hava "import glanceclient"
but requirements.txt not have python-glanceclient

Change-Id: I3ba7b9eb87ed799ad5ea61f842dd1bbe08d533a8
Story: 2005097
Task: 29710

commit_message:
Allow building configdrive from JSON in the API

Extend the API with the ability to build config drives from meta_data,
network_data and user_data, where meta_data and network_data are JSON
objects, and user_data is either a JSON object, a JSON array or
raw contents as a string.

This change uses openstacksdk (which is already an indirect dependency)
for building config drives.

Change-Id: Ie1f399a4cb6d4fe5afec79341d3bccc0f81204b2
Story: #2005083
Task: #29663

[{'created': '2019-03-06 19:35:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add API header config to JSON ingester

Add the 'api_default_headers' field which specifies a hash/dict
of headers to pass with each API call w.r.t. that JSON ingester.
Main usage is to specify API microversion. For example:

api_default_headers:
  X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version: "2.26"

Change-Id: Ie859e45ea03135aa21196fe19767f28627e76c3b
partially-implements: bp json-data-model
'}]
commit_message:
Add API header config to JSON ingester

Add the 'api_default_headers' field which specifies a hash/dict
of headers to pass with each API call w.r.t. that JSON ingester.
Main usage is to specify API microversion. For example:

api_default_headers:
  X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version: "2.26"

Change-Id: Ie859e45ea03135aa21196fe19767f28627e76c3b
partially-implements: bp json-data-model

commit_message:
JSON ingester deployment enhancements

Allows json ingester config YAMLs to use the !ref tag to reference
previously defined reusable structures, which makes deployment much
more convenient.

Allows devstack plugin to optionally enable JSON ingester feature.

Renamed and reorganized the JSON ingester config options.

Adds CI job which sets up JSON ingester.

partially-implements: bp json-data-model
Change-Id: I6391224c99249d16fe943b8f00fe12d1e6b7d8e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-06 16:02:15.000000000', 'message': 'Temporary marking ironic-standalone non-voting

The ironic-standalone job is failing because the most recent IPA
image has only python3 and ansible uses python 2 as default
interpreter, resulting in a /usr/bin/python not found error.
Marking ironic-standalone non voting and removing it from the
gate until we can run ansible with python3 on remote machines.

Change-Id: I56768d7c8a577f267172de02d77e2cc2ead785ad
'}]
commit_message:
Temporary marking ironic-standalone non-voting

The ironic-standalone job is failing because the most recent IPA
image has only python3 and ansible uses python 2 as default
interpreter, resulting in a /usr/bin/python not found error.
Marking ironic-standalone non voting and removing it from the
gate until we can run ansible with python3 on remote machines.

Change-Id: I56768d7c8a577f267172de02d77e2cc2ead785ad

commit_message:
Drop installing python-libvirt system package

Pip will install libvirt-python later in the process and with pip >= 10
it will fail to remove the system version.

Change-Id: I33be5426ce8ff2301d28096af11a1023b8048a15
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561597

messages:
[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-10-26 13:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2017-10-26 17:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

needs a release note, and the functional tests need to pass, too :)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-10-31 10:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-11-02 22:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2017-11-03 02:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-11-06 18:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-11-15 22:08:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm not certain --detail is used anywhere else in OSC, but this really doesn't fit the spirit of a show command.

The data returned by the API with this option is a list/dict of dicts, this is really a list command with a new column and I think it should be presented to the user that way.  Changing the returned data from a singleton into a un-decoded dict is very user-unfriendly.


For compatibility we can leave the show command alone for now, but I think we need to re-work this into quota list [--detaill]  and the --detail option adds an 'in-use' or 'used' or whatever column."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-11-17 20:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

Thx for review guys.
@Dean: I will look how to do it in "list" command then.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-01 11:35:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Dean: but please note that there is already "List" command for quota: https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/blob/master/openstackclient/common/quota.py and it's behavior is different.
So how I could fit details into it?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-01 13:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow

@Dean: also I don't see any example of Show command which would display more than two columns ("Field" and "Value"). Do You know if there is any example of such command and how it could/should looks like?
Currently I think that returning those values in way as I did it is the best solution for OSC - also it is like that e.g. in novaclient already'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-12-01 15:44:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Your point about a show command having more than two columns is what I am talking about with "this output is a list command".  That is the fundamental difference between show and list, shoe is a multiple key-value output of a single where each 'row' is a single k-v, list has multiple resources with all of the values in a row.

The suggestion for quota list [--detail] is to add to the existing command, triggered by the --detail option to change its action.  We do this elsewhere, the point is that 'quota list' produces rows of quotas'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-01 21:20:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Dean: ok, now I understand Your point, thx. But I still have one doubt. Currently "quota show" command displays "not default quota values" configured for tenants. Do You want to change change it's behavior completely when flag "--detail" will be added? IMHO it will not be too user friendly.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:53:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 11:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 11:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 12:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-05 14:46:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-12-06 17:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:33:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:33:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

I'm not really a fan of the mix-in class, we don't do that very often, and never directly in commands that I can think of.  It looks like the use-case for doing that is no longer present as the current show command only has code moved.  It looks like that is going to change the current quota show command.

I think we will probably hold those sorts of changed until OSC 4 as it is a backward-compatibility change.  I will admit that I do not have all of the nuances of the quota stuff in my head right now so I may be missing something here."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-11 20:53:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

 > current show command only has code moved.  It looks like that is

Sorry but I don't understand. How it changes show command behavior? And about what mixin class You are talking about exactly?

So do You want to wait for OSC 4 with this change? Can You tell me then when it is planned to be released?
And second thing, how You prefer to do that quota commands then?"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-12-11 20:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Add support for get details of Quota

With passing "--detail" argument to "openstack quota list", details
about current usage should be returned.
It is currently supported by Nova and Neutron so details of
resources from those projects can be returned.

Change-Id: I48fda15b34283bb7c66ea18ed28262f48b9229fe
Related-Bug: #1716043

commit_message:
Add possibility to filter images using member_status

In order to see image sharing membership it is required to additionally
pass member_status filter to API. Otherwise only those with status 'all'
will be returned. Thus adding possibility to see images shared with
project to be approved or rejected.

Change-Id: Ifd6e13e5a4ef09fbc29e76d464c93fbdbb178ae4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 11:43:15.000000000', 'message': "Don't always validate heat stack when adding parameters

There are certain cases we add parameters to plan environment
when creating and updating a plan. As part of that action we
aslo try to validate the stack/template. However, validation
would fail, if we've resource mappings in user-environment that
are not merged/added to the plan yet.

This adds new input flag to plan create and update workflows which
can then be changed in python-tripleoclient, so as not to imapct the
UI workflows.

Change-Id: I9c54379925339eaaa9a0ee61cb823bddc95737c7
Partial-Bug: #1817539
"}, {'created': '2019-02-25 12:34:42.000000000', 'message': "Don't always validate heat stack when adding parameters

when creating and updating a plan. As part of that action we
aslo try to validate the stack/template. However, validation
would fail, if we've resource mappings in user-environment that
are not merged/added to the plan yet.

This adds new input flag to plan create and update workflows which
can then be changed in python-tripleoclient, so as not to imapct the
UI workflows.

Change-Id: I9c54379925339eaaa9a0ee61cb823bddc95737c7
Partial-Bug: #1817539
"}]
commit_message:
Don't always validate heat stack when adding parameters

There are certain cases we add parameters to plan environment
when creating and updating a plan. As part of that action we
aslo try to validate the stack/template. However, validation
would fail, if we've resource mappings in user-environment that
are not merged/added to the plan yet.

This adds new input flag to plan create and update workflows which
can then be changed in python-tripleoclient, so as not to imapct the
UI workflows.

Change-Id: I9c54379925339eaaa9a0ee61cb823bddc95737c7
Partial-Bug: #1817539

commit_message:
Set Tempest's service_availability setting for Barbican

Tempest's service_available config option includes all the service
availability which is further used by tests to take decision of skip
or run the test.

For example, [service_available].barbican is true then, barbican test will run
or if [service_available].barbican is false then, all barbican related tests either
in barbican tempest plugin or any other plugins[1] will be skipped.

So it is important that when barbican is installed via devstack plugin then,
it set the service_available.barbican value to True in tempest conf.

This commit add the setting of barbican service[2] on barbican devstack plugin.

Related-Bug: #1743688
Related-Bug: #1817154

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia-tempest-plugin/blob/0a0f9b342a73c924ba9e7142878a2889ac2061aa/octavia_tempest_plugin/tests/barbican_scenario/v2/test_tls_barbican.py#L53
[2] https://github.com/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin/blob/123dd7d4162c39a1cb4b4c1b09a5dceaee127eb6/barbican_tempest_plugin/config.py#L18

Change-Id: I7fd60d48802cc5e9071c39eaeb83351bec36cc41

[{'created': '2019-03-05 02:32:02.000000000', 'message': 'mistral-executor include host /etc/environment

The undercloud host file /etc/environment will be documented as where
proxy environment variables will be set when the undercloud is behind
a proxy server.

These variables also need to be set inside the mistral_executor
container for the pre-deployment image prepare to access external
registries. This change will make that possible without any further
changes required from the deployer.

Change-Id: Ie8924833a2410eea096fda955c8c6df9b1f0e207
Partial-Bug: #1818590
'}]
commit_message:
mistral-executor include host /etc/environment

The undercloud host file /etc/environment will be documented as where
proxy environment variables will be set when the undercloud is behind
a proxy server.

These variables also need to be set inside the mistral_executor
container for the pre-deployment image prepare to access external
registries. This change will make that possible without any further
changes required from the deployer.

Change-Id: Ie8924833a2410eea096fda955c8c6df9b1f0e207
Partial-Bug: #1818590

commit_message:
Fix missing size value in snapshot instance

This patch fixes the size value not being present in share
snapshot instances, which causes drivers to not being able to access
this property unless they read the size from the snapshot model.

Closes-bug: #1815587
Change-Id: I730629ea460c316a02f8dffb4a55eea04ad619c9

commit_message:
ci/environments/ovb-ha: force Docker for ContainerCli

Until we get CentOS8, we can't test Pacemaker + Podman together, so
until then we'll force ContainerCli to be docker for OVB HA jobs.

Depends-On: I2d8f484feb1b1fc2b88ab1f7b37b44324183643e
Change-Id: I5c2d230f5cc63009c7b02272112b2d4af4669da7

commit_message:
image build: temporarily add DIB debug flag

Bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1818305 can't be easily replicated,
and without additional information it's impossible to understand what's
failing.
This patch enables temporarily the debug flag that is usually excessively
verbose to be kept enabled

Change-Id: Iab18d18187ada40773224d0c9cf283e01cec7130

we get them working with Podman.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-14 14:55:53.000000000', 'message': 'Run NetworkDeployment as async task

This commit adds special handling of the NetworkDeployment such that it
will be run as an async task with ansible. This should prevent any
issues where the network configuration causes the ssh connection to drop
and the ansible task to either be unnecessarily retried or failed.

Also added are three variables that can be used to control the async
behavior:

async_deployment: boolean which will toggle running all deployments in
                  async mode.
async_timeout:    timeout in seconds to wait for async tasks
async_poll:       interval in seconds to check async task status

These variables can only be set if running the config-download process
manually, however a future patch could wire them up to Heat parameters.

Change-Id: If1f35980a98a9015ca65f2c6a3e4db04725f1c10
Closes-Bug: #1792343

commit_message:
Run NetworkDeployment as async task

This commit adds special handling of the NetworkDeployment such that it
will be run as an async task with ansible. This should prevent any
issues where the network configuration causes the ssh connection to drop
and the ansible task to either be unnecessarily retried or failed.

Also added are three variables that can be used to control the async
behavior:

async_deployment: boolean which will toggle running all deployments in
                  async mode.
async_timeout:    timeout in seconds to wait for async tasks
async_poll:       interval in seconds to check async task status

These variables can only be set if running the config-download process
manually, however a future patch could wire them up to Heat parameters.

Change-Id: If1f35980a98a9015ca65f2c6a3e4db04725f1c10
Closes-Bug: #1792343
(cherry picked from commit ac4ac838e1a3eda32bbf8e9c0a61a89142688194)

and while we work on the root cause, adding it to skip list.

https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/issue/829?kanban-status=2027734

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-08 09:57:38.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Do not restart rabbit bundles during a minor update

It makes no sense since we are going to stop the cluster on the node
anyway.

Change-Id: Id1d671506d3ec827bc311b47d9363952e1239ce3
'}, {'created': '2019-02-08 10:06:31.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Do not restart rabbit bundles during a minor update

It makes no sense since we are going to stop the cluster on the node
anyway.

Change-Id: Id1d671506d3ec827bc311b47d9363952e1239ce3
'}, {'created': '2019-02-19 17:43:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Do not restart rabbit bundles during a minor update

It makes no sense since we are going to stop the cluster on the node
anyway.

By exporting the variable TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE without a value we
tell docker (and podman) to inherit this value from the host.

Change-Id: Id1d671506d3ec827bc311b47d9363952e1239ce3
'}, {'created': '2019-02-19 18:48:58.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Do not restart bundles during a minor update

It makes no sense since we are going to stop the cluster on the node
anyway. With change Ib3562adbd83f7162c2aeb450329b7cc4ab200fc2 we
inject the TRIPLEO_MINOR_UDPATE variable into the update playbooks
and we also push it (by default to false) inside the paunch start
container step.

By exporting the variable TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE without a value we
tell docker (and podman) to inherit this value from the host.
When the env variable is set to true we avoid calling pcs inside
the containers to restart the bundles.

Change-Id: Id1d671506d3ec827bc311b47d9363952e1239ce3
'}, {'created': '2019-02-20 06:29:30.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Do not restart bundles during a minor update

It makes no sense since we are going to stop the cluster on the node
anyway. With change Ib3562adbd83f7162c2aeb450329b7cc4ab200fc2 we
inject the TRIPLEO_MINOR_UDPATE variable into the update playbooks
and we also push it (by default to false) inside the paunch start
container step.

By exporting the variable TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE without a value we
tell docker (and podman) to inherit this value from the host.
When the env variable is set to true we avoid calling pcs inside
the containers to restart the bundles.

Change-Id: Id1d671506d3ec827bc311b47d9363952e1239ce3
'}, {'created': '2019-02-20 14:49:47.000000000', 'message': "Do not restart bundles during a minor update

It makes no sense since we are going to stop the cluster on the node
anyway. With change Ib3562adbd83f7162c2aeb450329b7cc4ab200fc2 we
inject the TRIPLEO_MINOR_UDPATE variable into the update playbooks
and we also push it (by default to false) inside the paunch start
container step.

By exporting the variable TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE without a value we
tell docker (and podman) to inherit this value from the host.
When the env variable is set to true we avoid calling pcs inside
the containers to restart the bundles because at that point we
know that restarting the HA container would make no sense.

We tested the changes as follows:
A) Ran a minor update (openstack overcloud update prepare + openstack
overcloud update run --roles Controller) and observed that there were no
extra pcmk-managed bundles restarts (i.e. even when paunch decided to
invoke the <service>_restart_bundle it was a noop because
TRIPLEO_MINOR_UDPATE was 'true')
B) We ran a re-deploy without any changes and observed that no restart
of pcmk-managed bundles took place
C) We ran a re-deploy and forced some configuration changes and observed
that TRIPLEO_MINOR_UDPATE was false and that the
<service>_restart_bundle was run by paunch and that it restarted the
bundle that had the config changed.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id1d671506d3ec827bc311b47d9363952e1239ce3
"}, {'created': '2019-03-01 17:30:47.000000000', 'message': "Do not restart bundles during a minor update
