commit_message:
Remove 'mount.quobyte' and 'umount.quobyte'

Remove 'mount.quobyte' and 'umount.quobyte'
from rootwrap filters and use oslo.privsep.

Change-Id: I6f3d43f819eb0d9aad8a1925ed0b806df198c3fc
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Simplify running pylint

This commit does several things:

- Setup and run pylint directly rather than running through a script.
  This allows the user to see what is happening while the user is running
  through pylint.
- Allow the user to either run pylint on a particular changeset,
  or the entire manila tree.
- Allow the user to run on a particular changeset. Using like HEAD~1,
  etc.
- I disabled the tests that were reported by pylint.
  The thought here would be go through the failures
  and correct them.
- Update pylint to 2.1.1.

Change-Id: I398d1ba01a3fd7f1c86ad4065a7984d276f33383
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4d0abb4a149eea597e51f79c8e76d9d2284d65ee)

commit_message:
Add functional CI job and tests for segments

Added multi-node CI job to run functional tests.
This patch adds functional tests to check the behaviour
of Segment APIs.

Co-Authored-By: jayashri bidwe <jayashri.bidwe@nttdata.com>

[{'created': '2018-11-08 21:08:24.000000000', 'message': "Add cache=none option for qemu-img convert

There is limited page cache shared between the host and guest local
disks and we don't want image conversion operations to fill
it. Using cache=none option can also ensure that the data is on
persistent storage when the command exits.

Use cache=none option only if the filesystem where the instances are
mounted support O_DIRECT.

Change-Id: I4b7be98b5832ca8c580339fcfb7b9203264b5ff8

commit_message:
Improve libvirt image and snapshot handling

Use virt.images.convert_image instead of invoking 'qemu-img convert'
directly so that cache option can be set properly. i.e. cache=none
when O_DIRECT is supported by the filesystem.

The big advantage of this is that it will bypass the host page cache
so that converting large images won't evict guest data from the cache.

Refactor images.convert_image so that the compression option can be
controlled by the caller.

Change-Id: I4b7be98b5832ca8c580339fcfb7b9203264b5ff8
Signed-off-by: Jack Ding <jack.ding@windriver.com>
Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>

commit_message:
Add python-memcached library to test-requirements.txt

Horizon uses python-memcached while running "tox -e runserver"
so we need to add it to test-requirement.txt as well as
lower-constraints.txt.

Change-Id: I4319cf1a54310171baf1dbaf2e10acae8123dac6

subject: Fix formatter handling for python 3.7
messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-15 11:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-15 14:17:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28649, 'date': '2018-11-28 09:53:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I found the same solution before seeing this changeset. This is necessary for the command line tools not to fail under newer Python versions, as they will be stricter with `issubclass()`.

If the formatter is a function (deprecated), which it still is in practice, it's not a class and so the newer stricter issubclass() will fail, as it only allows to check classes against each other (rightfully so).

Checking if formatter is a class first before trying issubclass() is a valid fix and works even in the Python 2.7 case, as the class checked against is a new-style class."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-11-28 13:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-30 06:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-11-30 06:52:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix unit tests and test configuration

Fix post gate hook to accommodate for new os-testr
New versions now use .stestr instead of previous .testrepository
directory

Change-Id: Ib7541abb0bee619b87fbcc7fee5d5095255e1ec7
Closes-Bug: #1716746
(cherry picked from commit f9ea384efc86321e90b1bb93f6e1c09ffa868d62)

commit_message:
Fix py35 and sphinx-docs gates

Fix an issue where toxenv fails when it encounters a non-empty __pycache__
directory. This adjusts the options passed to find so that it is tolerant of
this scenario and allows tox runs to proceed.

Change-Id: I526a4f2a58dcc21045c5cab2f82c105861d7ac8f
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

commit_message:
Ceilometer chart: Add polling process with ipmi functionality

This commit adds the ability to deploy a polling process with ipmi
functionality to pull ipmi samples.
Story: 2005019
Task: 29819
Signed-off-by: Angie Wang <angie.wang@windriver.com>

Change-Id: Ib61d65f9ab815faa0d750422ffb0e36406dd3ccd

at all.

And with None it fails on

So in other words, set_metadata can:

- add new metadata
- update existing metadata
- remove metadata but only if the value is None for an existing key

And because of https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5a09c81af3b438ecbcf27fa653095ff55abb3ed4/nova/compute/api.py#L5340 the 'availability_zone' key is special in that you can't remove it once set - the only way to drop the AZ is to delete the aggregate itself.

Seems our API reference could be updated to explain this better. :)"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-01 16:53:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-03 15:24:53.000000000', 'message': "AZ operations: check host has no instances

This adds additional check to aggregate API calls: Update Aggregate,
Add Host, Remove Host. That check makes sure there are no instances
in the targeted host for adding and removing host to aggregate. Also
with that change, it's not possible to rename AZ it the corresponding
aggregate has instances in any hosts.

This was done because after making operations described above the
obsolete value for AZ is left in instance table.  Alternative solution
was proposed in Icf58b0fd2e1d77abb817ea46f188f386863578d0.

Change-Id: Ic27195e46502067c87ee9c71a811a3ca3f610b73
Closes-Bug: #1378904
"}, {'created': '2017-10-09 06:59:42.000000000', 'message': "AZ operations: check host has no instances

This adds additional check to aggregate API calls: Update Aggregate,
Add Host, Remove Host. That check makes sure there are no instances
in the targeted host for adding and removing host to aggregate. Also
with that change, it's not possible to rename AZ it the corresponding
aggregate has instances in any hosts.

This was done because after making operations described above the
obsolete value for AZ is left in instance table.  Alternative solution
was proposed in Icf58b0fd2e1d77abb817ea46f188f386863578d0.

Change-Id: Ic27195e46502067c87ee9c71a811a3ca3f610b73
Closes-Bug: #1378904
"}, {'created': '2017-10-11 10:12:53.000000000', 'message': "AZ operations: check host has no instances

This adds additional check to aggregate API calls: Update Aggregate,
Add Host, Remove Host. That check makes sure there are no instances
in the targeted host for adding and removing host to aggregate. Also
with that change, it's not possible to rename AZ it the corresponding
aggregate has instances in any hosts.

This was done because after making operations described above the
obsolete value for AZ is left in instance table.  Alternative solution
was proposed in Icf58b0fd2e1d77abb817ea46f188f386863578d0.

Change-Id: Ic27195e46502067c87ee9c71a811a3ca3f610b73
Closes-Bug: #1378904
"}, {'created': '2019-02-05 16:13:52.000000000', 'message': 'Check hosts have no instances for AZ rename

Update aggregate API call has the ability to update availability zone metadata
for an aggregate. If the aggregate is not empty (has hosts) it updates
aggregate metadata only that leads to discrepancy for objects
saving availability zone as a string but not reference.
From devstack DB they are:
- cinder.backups.availability_zone
- cinder.consistencygroups.availability_zone
- cinder.groups.availability_zone
- cinder.services.availability_zone
- cinder.volumes.availability_zone
- neutron.agents.availability_zone
- neutron.networks.availability_zone_hints
- neutron.router_extra_attributes.availability_zone_hints
- nova.dns_domains.availability_zone
- nova.instances.availability_zone
- nova.volume_usage_cache.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_dns_domains.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_instances.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_volume_usage_cache.availability_zone

Why that's bad?
First, API and Horizon show different values for host and instance for
example. Second, migration for instances with changed availability
zone fails with "No valid host found" for old AZ.

This change adds an additional check to aggregate an Update Aggregate API call.
With the check, it's not possible to rename AZ if the corresponding
aggregate has instances in any hosts.

Change-Id: Ic27195e46502067c87ee9c71a811a3ca3f610b73
Closes-Bug: #1378904
'}, {'created': '2019-02-06 10:53:54.000000000', 'message': 'Check hosts have no instances for AZ rename

- cinder.services.availability_zone
- cinder.volumes.availability_zone

commit_message:
Check hosts have no instances for AZ rename

Update aggregate and update aggregate metadata API calls have the
ability to update availability zone name for the aggregate. If the
aggregate is not empty (has hosts with instances on it)
the update leads to discrepancy for objects saving availability zone as a
string but not reference.

From devstack DB they are:
- cinder.backups.availability_zone
- cinder.consistencygroups.availability_zone
- cinder.groups.availability_zone
- cinder.services.availability_zone
- cinder.volumes.availability_zone
- neutron.agents.availability_zone
- neutron.networks.availability_zone_hints
- neutron.router_extra_attributes.availability_zone_hints
- nova.dns_domains.availability_zone
- nova.instances.availability_zone
- nova.volume_usage_cache.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_dns_domains.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_instances.availability_zone
- nova.shadow_volume_usage_cache.availability_zone

Why that's bad?
First, API and Horizon show different values for host and instance for
example. Second, migration for instances with changed availability
zone fails with "No valid host found" for old AZ.

This change adds an additional check to aggregate an Update Aggregate API call.
With the check, it's not possible to rename AZ if the corresponding
aggregate has instances in any hosts.

PUT /os-aggregates/{aggregate_id} and
POST /os-aggregates/{aggregate_id}/action return HTTP 400 for
availability zone renaming if the hosts of the aggregate have any instances.
It's similar to conflicting AZ names error already available.

Change-Id: Ic27195e46502067c87ee9c71a811a3ca3f610b73
Closes-Bug: #1378904
